p: Cobalt can also be precipitated as cobalt oxalate prior to purification using ammonium oxalate, as demonstrated by Nan et al. [ 151], or using oxalic acid as in Sohn et al. process [ 152]. However, to minimize coprecipitation of other elements, the deposition rate should not exceed 90%. Frequently, Co(II) is precipitated as carbonate, hydroxide, or oxalate from a solution purified from Fe(III), Al(III), and Cu(II). For manganese and nickel, precipitation as carbonate or hydroxide is usually performed after recovering cobalt.
